greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of n-length words w over a k-ary alphabet {a1, a2, ..., ak} such that #(w,a1) >= #(w,a2) >= ... >= #(w,ak) >= 1, where #(w,x) counts the letters x in word w; triangle T(n,k), n >= 0, 0 <= k <= n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is the sum of multinomials M(n; lambda), where lambda ranges over all partitions of n into parts that form a multiset of size k.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: T(4,2) = 10: aaab, aaba, aabb, abaa, abab, abba, baaa, baab, baba, bbaa.
T(4,3) = 12: aabc, aacb, abac, abca, acab, acba, baac, baca, bcaa, caab, caba, cbaa.
T(5,2) = 15: aaaab, aaaba, aaabb, aabaa, aabab, aabba, abaaa, abaab, ababa, abbaa, baaaa, baaab, baaba, babaa, bbaaa.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember;
b:= proc(n, i) option remember; expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n$2)):
mathematica: b[n_, i_, t_] := b[n, i, t] = If[t == 1, 1/n!, Sum[b[n - j, j, t - 1]/j!, {j, i, n/t}]]; t[n_, k_] := If[n*k == 0, If[n == k, 1, 0], n!*b[n, 1, k]]; Table[Table[t[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 13 2013, translated from first Maple *)
program: {my(t=T(10)); for(n=1, #t, for(k=0, n-1, print1(polcoeff(t[n], k), ", ")); print)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 20 2017
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 21 2013
